content.description: This is a short, cool , steep crack on the wall to the right of Ren.  Thin to fist.
content.location: On the N.face of Target Rock, facing North, and on the short steep wall to the right of the 4 bolt slab route Ren.  Scramble up talus to get to the start of this climb.

climbs.name: Spirit Of The Dead
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer and Brad Gill, January 1990

content.description: This is a low angle face climb on good rock.
content.protection: two bolts plus gear for a belay
content.location: This face route is on the southeast shoulder of Target Rock.

climbs.name: Smears for Fears (aka Poodle Pile)
climbs.fa: (TR) Chris Miller, April 1998, FL: Tad Newman & Ronnie Miller, 1998

content.description:
This unpleasant route should never have been bolted. Grain your way up the face/arete left of

Ren

cursing as your footholds fall away to the ground and into your belayer's eyes...it may clean up sometime in the next century. Deserving of negative stars if that's possible.
content.protection: 4 bolts (3/8"), gear to 3" for the anchor

content.description: This is a 4 bolt face route that goes up a gritty slab. You need to scramble up some boulders to the base.  It is to the right of Visualize World Peace, and up and left of the bullseye and all the lower Target Rock routes on the west face. Ren faces the parking lot (west).
content.protection: QDs for the bolts. Gear to 3" for the anchor.
content.location: N. face of Target Rock. On a slab up the talus a bit, and faces the parking lot.

climbs.name: Pearls Before Swine
climbs.fa: Scott Cole and Stephanie Bussell, April 1991

content.description: This goes up a steep, strenuous face, with a vertical hand crack above.  It's good quality, but runout.
content.location: This route is just right of some trees near the left edge of the north face.

content.description: This is a low quality crack and face route.
content.location: This is on the lower part of the north face, below and left of Ren and Stimpy.  It follows a crack that arches up and left.
